channel.title: math.GM updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GM updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Density of Squarefree Totients $p-1$ and Primitive Roots
item.description: arXiv:2410.03683v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This note determines an effective asymptotic formula for the number of squarefree totients $p-1$ with a fixed primitive root $u\ne \pm 1, v^2$.
item.dc:creator: N. A. Carella

item.title: A tensor-based approach to solving linear systems involving Kronecker sum of matrices
item.description: arXiv:2410.04026v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A tensor-based formula for solving the linear system involving Kronecker sum is proposed. It is shown that the linear system involving Kronecker sum of matrices is directly related to the matrix and tensor forms of Sylvester equation. The new tensor-based formula indicates that a Sylvester tensor equation has a unique solution if the sum of spectra of the matrices does not contain zero. As an application, we solve the discretized Poisson equation on a rectangular domain and Dirichlet boundary conditions. In 2d, we show that both the new formula and the fast Poisson solver based on diagonalization have the same cost $\mathcal {O}(n^{3/2})$. In 3d, the new formula has the cost $\mathcal {O}(n^{4/3})$ while cyclic reduction and successive over-relaxation methods have a complexity of $\mathcal {O}(n^{3/2})$.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Y. Al-Dweik, Abdallah Sayyed-Ahmad

item.title: Existence of limit of multivariable function
item.description: arXiv:2403.19673v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This article provides several theorems regarding the existence of limit for multivariable function, among which Theorem 1 and Theorem 3 relax the requirement for sequence of Heine's definition of limit. These results address the question of which paths need to be considered to determine the existence of limit for multivariable function.
item.dc:creator: Ming Yang
